member.name: F:Autodesk.InventorBuilder.VersionInfo.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: Inventor Build Number Centralization(for C# projects) This holds central version numbers for .NET assemblies.

member.name: F:Autodesk.InventorBuilder.VersionInfo.CopyRightFrom1996
member.summary: Inventor Copyright Year Centralization(for C# projects) To update the copyright year for all executables and About dialogs, we need to change the end year in below block, for example, for Ada release, replace all end years with 2020.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.CadDoc
member.summary: Easy access to components of an Inventor filename, and other file-related functions. An instance of this class (named ThisDoc) is created in a rule.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.CadDoc.Document
member.summary: Gets the Inventor Document from which this rule is being run. If the rule is not external, this will be the document in which the rule is stored.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.CadDoc.ModelDocument
member.summary: Gets the Inventor Document from which this rule is being run. If the rule is not external, this will be the document in which the rule is stored.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.DocumentUtils.DisplayNameExt(Inventor.Document)
member.summary: Get the document filename with extension.
member.remarks: doc.DisplayName can leave off the extension if the Windows Explorer setting is "Hide extensions for known file types" This function will always return the filename with extension, unless the document has not been saved.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.DpiConverter.DipToPixels(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Convert device-independent pixels to physical pixels.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.DpiConverter.DipToPixelsInX(System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert device-independent pixels to physical pixels in the X direction.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.DpiConverter.DipToPixelsInY(System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert device-independent pixels to physical pixels in the X direction.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.DpiConverter.DipToPixelsConversionFactors
member.summary: Get an array of multiplicative factors that can be used to convert width and height (in that order) from device-independent pixels to physical pixels. pixels = factor * DIP

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.CadViewBalloons
member.summary: Provide a function to re-attach balloons to components in an assembly drawing, or move them to an invisible layer if they can't be attached.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.CadViewBalloons.FindClosestPoint(Inventor.Point2d,Inventor.Point2d,Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ComponentBalloonEligibility)
member.summary: Find the closest point (on any eligible drawing curve) to "pos", then use "basePoint" (if not null) to get a "better" close point on that curve.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.PromptedEntryTextBox
member.summary: Store a text box that contains a prompted entry. Each entry has a UniqueID.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.FileUtil
member.summary: Mostly path-related utilities for Inventor files.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.FileUtil.GetRelativeFileNames(System.String,Inventor.Document,Inventor.InventorServerObject)
member.summary: Get full document-relative and project-relative paths for the given relative path name.
member.remarks: The function name is misleading. It returns a collection of absolute paths. The input is a relative path.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.FileUtil.AbsoluteFileNameRelativeToDoc(System.String,Inventor.Document,Inventor.InventorServerObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Try to find a file specified by a relative or absolute name. If found, return an absolute file path for the file.
member.remarks: NOTE: this cannot be used for assembly document names with LOD names appended. But it could be adapted for that purpose.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.FileUtil.MatchesPartialPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tests to see if two file names, paths, or partial paths could be equivalent. This is used for external rule file paths. The first argument might be a full path, or it might only contain the last levels of the path including filename. The second argument is a full path.
member.param: At least the filename, usually without extension. Might include some last levels or all of the path.

member.name: F:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InputListBoxDialog.heightWanted
member.summary: Height set explicitly by the caller.

member.name: F:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InputListBoxDialog.widthWanted
member.summary: Width set explicitly by the caller.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InputListBoxDialog.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new InputListBoxDialog.
member.param: Dialog width in Device Independent Pixels. If this is zero, the width will be sized to fit the contents.
Dialog height in Device Independent Pixels. If this is zero, the width will be sized to fit the contents.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InputListBoxDialog.OnLoad(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Override to fill list box from list of items, and set initially selected item.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InputListBoxDialog.OnTextboxContentsResized(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.ContentsResizedEventArgs)
member.summary: Set the height of the prompt textbox to match its contents.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsFinder
member.summary: Provides methods to find a UCS (or origin workplanes) in a document or component.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsInComponent
member.summary: A UCS in a component occurrence. if the occurrence is null, then the UCS is in the containing assembly document.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsInComponent.Transformation
member.summary: Get the transformation in the space of the containing assembly.
member.returns: A matrix or null. A null return should be interpreted as the identity matrix.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsInComponent.GetWorkPlane(Inventor.UserCoordinateSystem,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a UCS workplane, with the indices following the same order as the Constraint Set command uses.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsInComponent.GetWorkplaneIndex(Inventor.UserCoordinateSystem,Inventor.WorkPlane)
member.summary: Get the index of the workplane in the UCS that contains it.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsWorkplaneInComponent
member.summary: A work plane within a UcsInComponent.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsOrOrigin
member.summary: Wrap either a UCS or the origin planes.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsOrOrigin.IsSameUcs(Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.InventorEntities.UcsOrOrigin)
member.summary: See if the other is referring to the same UCS. The caller must also check to see if the occurrences are the same.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath
member.summary: Provides math functions that are not found in the standard System.Math namespace. Some of these are similar to the functions that are available for Inventor parameter expressions (e.g. in the Parameters dialog).

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.Ceil(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to the specified number. (This uses the standard .NET Math.Ceiling method.)

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.Sign0(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns an integer that indicates the sign of a number.
member.returns: 1 if the number is greater than zero. 0 if the number is zero or negative.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.Ln(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm of a specified number. (This uses the standard .NET Math.Log method.)

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.MaxOfMany(System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns the largest value from a list of two or more numbers. Example: min = MaxOfMany(x, y, 12)

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.MinOfMany(System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns the smallest value from a list of two or more numbers. Example: min = MinOfMany(x, y, 12)

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.EqualWithinTolerance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns True if two numbers are equal within the specified tolerance (that is, almost equal).

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.EqualWithinTolerance(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true if the two numbers are equal within a tolerance of 1.0E-7.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.MakeList(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an ArrayList from one or more values.
member.returns: An ArrayList that contains the values provided.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.LmiMath.MakePath(System.Object[])
member.summary: Defines the path to a component name in a subassembly. To specify the path, list all subassembly levels in the order they appear in the assembly model browser tree. This function is required if you want to specify a component name when the same name also exists elsewhere in the assembly.
member.param: A list of levels that specify the path to the component.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RoundingMethod
member.summary: The method to be used when rounding numbers.

member.name: F:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RoundingMethod.Round
member.summary: Round to the nearest multiple of the rounding factor.

member.name: F:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RoundingMethod.RoundUp
member.summary: Round up to a multiple of the rounding factor that is greater than or equal to the current value.

member.name: F:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RoundingMethod.RoundDown
member.summary: Round down to a multiple of the rounding factor that is less than or equal to the current value.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.MathString
member.summary: Provides functions to convert between numbers and text strings, including formatting as fractions.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.MathString.FormatAsFraction(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Formats a number as a fraction for inch measurements, with denominator as power of 2 (up to maximum of 128). Return a fraction, or number and fraction (e.g. 3 5/8), or decimal number if the input is not a power of 2 fraction (within 0.0000001)
member.param: Number of decimal places for output (only used if it's not a fraction).
member.returns: Either a fractional string (e.g. 3 5/8) or a decimal string.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.MathString.FormatAsFraction(System.Double)
member.summary: Formats a number as a fraction for inch measurements, with denominator as power of 2 (up to maximum of 128). Return a fraction, or number and fraction (e.g. 3 5/8), or decimal number if the input is not a power of 2 fraction (within 0.0000001)
member.returns: Either a fractional string (e.g. 3 5/8) or a decimal string (with up to 3 digits to the right of the decimal separator).

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.MathString.RoundToFraction(System.Double,System.Double,Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RoundingMethod)
member.summary: Formats a numeric value as a text string, in fraction form to represent inch measurements. Returns a fraction(for example, "1/2"), or a number and fraction(for example, "3 5/8").
member.param: The level of precision wanted. Must be 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, 1/16, 1/32, 1/64, or 1/128.
member.returns: A text string that represents the numeric value.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.MathString.CDblAny(System.String)
member.summary: Like the standard CDbl function, this converts a string to a double-precision number. But unlike CDbl, this will work on a string that uses either "." or "," as the decimal separator.
member.param: A string that represents a number.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateNameUtils
member.summary: Provides functions to work with model state names. (In English, Master will be most likely be renamed to Primary in a future release.)

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateNameUtils.IsPrimaryModelStateName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the name is a Primary model state name in any language.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateNameUtils.CurrentPrimaryModelStateName
member.summary: Gets the name of the Primary model state in the current language.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateNameUtils.GetLocalizedName(System.String)
member.summary: If the name is the name of the Primary model state in any language, then this returns the corresponding name in the current language. Otherwise it returns the argument unchanged.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateNameUtils.GetExpressionForCapture(System.String)
member.summary: If the name is the Primary model state name in the current language, this will return an expression that gets the primary model state name in the current language. (The expression will work in future, in whatever language is current at the time it is evaluated.)

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateOperations
member.summary: Model state operations that are called by functions in iLogic rule code.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateOperations.GetActiveModelStateName(Inventor.Document,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the name of the active model state in the document. If this is the system-generated Primary model state, the name will be localized.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateOperations.GetActiveModelStateNameWithNoExceptions(Inventor.Document)
member.summary: Gets the name of the active model state. If this is the system-generated Primary model state, the name will be localized. Returns null if there is an exception.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateOperations.SetActiveModelStateName(Inventor.Document,System.String,Inventor.InventorServer,System.String)
member.summary: This will accept a name in any language for the Primary (Master) model state.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateOperations.SetActiveModelStateName(Inventor.ComponentOccurrence,System.String,Inventor.InventorServer,System.String)
member.summary: This will accept a name in any language for the Primary (Master) model state. A localized name in the current language is preferred : performance will be better.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStatesGlobalScope
member.summary: This object will set a document to all members edit scope. When this object is disposed, the previous edit scope setting will be restored.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ObjectTypeEditScopeEnum
member.summary: iLogic object types for model state edit scope.

member.name: F:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ObjectTypeEditScopeEnum.All
member.summary: No specific object type. This scope applies to any object that does not override it with a specific setting. It is set on the iLogicVb object.

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateUtils
member.summary: Utilities for documents and components with model states.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateUtils.GetFactoryDocument(Inventor.Document)
member.summary: For a part or assembly, gets the factory document. If the argument is not a member document, this returns the argument unchanged. If the argument is a drawing, returns null.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.ModelStateUtils.GetModelStates(Inventor.Document)
member.summary: Gets the ModelStates object. Can only be applied to a factory document.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.Properties.Resources.List
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to List.

member.name: P:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.Resources.ExceptionMsgs.CannotGetActiveModelStateInMember
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {0}: The active model state is not available in a member document. (Document name: "{1}")..

member.name: T:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs
member.summary: Provides the InputListBox and InputRadioBox functions.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputListBox(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a single item can be chosen from a list.
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
Dialog height in Device Independent Pixels. If this is zero, the width will be sized to fit the contents.
Dialog width in Device Independent Pixels. If this is zero, the width will be sized to fit the contents.
member.returns: The selected item, or Nothing if the dialog was cancelled.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputListBox(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a single item can be chosen from a list.
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
member.returns: The selected item, or Nothing if the dialog was cancelled.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputListBox(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a single item can be chosen from a list.
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
member.returns: The selected item, or Nothing if the dialog was cancelled.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputListBox(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Object)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a single item can be chosen from a list.
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
member.returns: The selected item, or Nothing if the dialog was cancelled.

member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a single item can be chosen from a list.
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
member.returns: The selected item, or Nothing if the dialog was cancelled.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputRadioBox(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a choice can be made between two options. (Returns True if the first option was selected, and False otherwise.)
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
The label for the first option.
The label for the second option.
Set this to True to choose the first option by default.
member.returns: True if the first option was selected. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputRadioBox(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a choice can be made between two options. (Returns True if the first option was selected, and False otherwise.)
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
The label for the first option.
The label for the second option.
member.returns: True if the first option was selected. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Autodesk.iLogic.Runtime.RunDialogs.InputRadioBox(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shows a dialog in which a choice can be made between two options. (Returns True if the first option was selected, and False otherwise.)
member.param: A prompt to show in the dialog.
The label for the first option.
The label for the second option.
Set this to True to choose the first option by default.
member.returns: True if the first option was selected. False otherwise.

member.name: M:iLogic.CadObjectUtil.GetObjectType(System.Object)
member.summary: Helper method to get the type of an Inventor API object.

member.name: M:iLogic.CadObjectUtil.GetPropertyValue(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of the specified property of the object. Returns null if it's not available.
